text.p: Polish steel trader Stalexport SA on Tuesday welcomed foreign investors' high interest in its $50 million convertible bond issue, launched on March 26 in London.
The company's president Ryszard Harhala confirmed at a news conference that the issue, maturing on April 3, 2002, had enjoyed a 79-percent oversubscription.
"The success of Stalexport will increase interest in the company and in Poland," he said.
Stalexport is the first Polish company to list its bonds in London. The bonds were offered with a yield of 8.316 percent and spread of 150 basis points about U.S. five-year treasury bonds.

Harhala confirmed that the issue had been bought by 106 investors, 40 percent of which came from Switzerland, 38 percent from other western European countries, 14 percent from the United States and four percent from mid-east countries.
